page.title: 11LOCAL CUSTOMS NEAR DEWSBURY
page.content: In Gawthorpe stands the maypole which has formed the central point of the May Day procession and celebrations in the area for the past 111 years. The maypole is also the finishing post for the World Coal Carrying Championships which take place annually on Easter Monday. Male competitors carry a sack of coal weighing 51 kilogrammes over a distance of approximately 1000 metres beginning at the Royal Oak Inn.Women carry a weight of 10 kilogrammes over a shorter distance. Tolling the Devil's Knell is a Dewsbury custom dating back to the fourteenth century.On Christmas Eve the tenor bell in the Parish Church is tolled once for every year since Christ's birth.It was a common belief that this custom kept the devil away from Dewsbury.
